00029 class AnalogInputSubsystem : public DeviceSubsystem {
00030     friend class USB_AI16_Family;
00031 
00032     // {{{ public constants
00033 public:
00034     /*
00035      * A/D calibration modes; if ground or reference mode is selected, only one A/D
00036      * sample may be taken at a time; that means, one channel and no oversampling;
00037      * attempting to read more than one channel or use an oversample setting of more
00038      * than zero will result in a timeout error
00039      */
00041     static const int CAL_MODE_NORMAL                = 0;        // normal measurement
00043     static const int CAL_MODE_GROUND                = 1;        // measure ground
00045     static const int CAL_MODE_REFERENCE             = 3;        // measure reference
00046 
00047     /*
00048      * A/D trigger and counter bits
00049      */
00051     static const int TRIG_MODE_CTR0_EXT             = 0x10;     // 1 == counter 0 externally triggered
00053     static const int TRIG_MODE_FALLING_EDGE         = 0x08;     // 1 == triggered by falling edge
00055     static const int TRIG_MODE_SCAN                 = 0x04;     // 1 == scan all channels, 0==single channel
00057     static const int TRIG_MODE_EXTERNAL             = 0x02;     // 1 == triggered by external pin on board
00059     static const int TRIG_MODE_TIMER                = 0x01;     // 1 == triggered by counter 2
00060 
00061     /*
00062      * range codes passed to setRange(); these values are defined by the device and must not be changed
00063      */
00065     static const int RANGE_0_10V                    = 0;        // 0-10V
00067     static const int RANGE_10V                      = 1;        // +/-10V
00069     static const int RANGE_0_5V                     = 2;        // 0-5V
00071     static const int RANGE_5V                       = 3;        // +/-5V
00073     static const int RANGE_0_2V                     = 4;        // 0-2V
00075     static const int RANGE_2V                       = 5;        // +/-2V
00077     static const int RANGE_0_1V                     = 6;        // 0-1V
00079     static const int RANGE_1V                       = 7;        // +/-1V
00080 
00082     static const int MIN_COUNTS                     = 0;
00084     static const int MAX_COUNTS                     = 0xffff;
00085 
00087     static const int CAL_TABLE_WORDS                = 64 * 1024;
00088     // }}}
00089 
00090     // {{{ protected constants
00091 protected:
00092     static const char RANGE_TEXT[][ 10 ];
00093     // }}}
00094 
00095     // {{{ protected members
00096 protected:
00097     /*
00098      * register indexes
00099      */
00100     static const int NUM_CONFIG_REGISTERS           = 20;       // number of "registers" (bytes) in config. block
00101     static const int NUM_MUX_CONFIG_REGISTERS       = 21;       // number of "registers" (bytes) in config. block when MUX installed
00102     static const int NUM_GAIN_CODE_REGISTERS        = 16;       // number of gain code (range) registers in config. block
00103     static const int REG_GAIN_CODE                  = 0;        // gain code (range) for A/D channel 0 (one of RANGE_* settings above)
00104                                                                 // gain codes for channels 1-15 occupy configuration block indexes 1-15
00105     static const int REG_CAL_MODE                   = 16;       // calibration mode (one of CAL_MODE_* settings below)
00106     static const int REG_TRIG_MODE                  = 17;       // trigger mode (one of TRIG_MODE_* settings below)
00107     static const int REG_START_END                  = 18;       // start and end channels for scan (bits 7-4 contain end channel, bits 3-0 contain start channel)
00108     static const int REG_OVERSAMPLE                 = 19;       // oversample setting (0-255 samples in addition to single sample)
00109     static const int REG_MUX_START_END              = 20;       // MUX start and end channels for scan (bits 7-4 contain end channel MS-nibble, bits 3-0 contain start channel MS-nibble)
00110 
00111     static const int DIFFERENTIAL_MODE              = 8;        // OR with range to enable differential mode for channels 0-7
00112     static const int MAX_OVERSAMPLE                 = 0xff;
00113     static const int TRIG_MODE_VALID_MASK           = (
00114         TRIG_MODE_CTR0_EXT
00115         | TRIG_MODE_FALLING_EDGE
00116         | TRIG_MODE_SCAN
00117         | TRIG_MODE_EXTERNAL
00118         | TRIG_MODE_TIMER );
00119 
00120     static const int AUTO_CAL_UNKNOWN               = 0;
00121     static const int AUTO_CAL_NOT_PRESENT           = 1;
00122     static const int AUTO_CAL_PRESENT               = 2;
00123 
00124     static const int MAX_CHANNELS                   = 128;      // maximum number of channels supported by this software
00125 
00126     int numChannels;                                            // number of A/D channels
00127     int numMUXChannels;                                         // number of MUXed A/D channels
00128     int channelsPerGroup;                                       // number of A/D channels in each config. group (1, 4 or 8 depending on model)
00129     int configBlockSize;                                        // size of configuration block (bytes)
00130     int autoCalFeature;                                         // cached A/D auto. cal. feature
00131     AI16_InputRange *inputRange;                                // range for each channel group
00132     bool *differentialMode;                                     // differential mode for each channel group
00133     int calMode;                                                // calibration mode (CAL_MODE_*)
00134     int triggerMode;                                            // trigger mode (TRIG_MODE_*)
00135     int startChannel;                                           // starting channel for scans
00136     int endChannel;                                             // ending channel for scans
00137     int overSample;                                             // over-samples
00138     unsigned short *readBulkBuffer;                             // buffer used during bulk read procedure
00139     int readBulkSamplesRequested;                               // total number of samples requested during bulk read procedure
00140     int readBulkSamplesRetrieved;                               // number of samples retrieved so far during  bulk read procedure
00141     bool autoConfig;                                            // true == automatically send modified configuration to device
00142     // }}}
00143

00145 protected:
00146     AnalogInputSubsystem &setScanRange( int startChannel, int numChannels );
00147     AnalogInputSubsystem( USBDevice &parent );
00148     virtual ~AnalogInputSubsystem();
00149     // }}}
